text: The Violin Concerto in E minor, Op. 64 is a work for orchestra and solo violin by Felix Mendelssohn. He completed the concerto in 1844. It was written for Leipzig concertmaster Ferdinand David. The sonata rondo finale is written in E major. The concerto is a pillar of the classical repertoire. ==References== * Woodstra, Chris, et al. 2005. All Music Guide to Classical Music. All Media Guide, LLC. p. 825\. . Category:Compositions by Felix Mendelssohn Mendelssohn Category:Compositions in E minor
title: Violin Concerto (Mendelssohn)
